translation.en: -Bon service. -Bon service!

You're quite young.
Thank you.
How are you? Hello!

translation.en: -Good evening. -Good evening.
I told Laurent Pourcel

translation.en: -Monsieur André! -Monsieur André!
He said, "Monsieur André."
I thought I have to tell you that.

-Thank you. -Thank you.

and seafood porridge without the porridge.

-No rice. -Okay.
So whatever you're doing is fine, just be very natural, soak in the atmosphere.

translation.en: Just be your normal self.

translation.en: That's for me?
Bonjour, Chef!

translation.en: -How are you? -I'm good. A bit tired.

Yes, but I've been in Singapore for ten years.
Ten years? -Right, because there was Jaan. -Yes.
translation.ja: 〈ここの前は ジャンにいたからか〉

translation.en: Yes. Very good.
Yes, it's good.
-And your career took off here as well. -Yes.
After Restaurant André, I want to do more.
translation.ja: 〈今後はいろんな挑戦を したいんです〉 〈今後はいろんな挑戦を したいんです〉 ジャック･プルセル

translation.en: Here, we're open 5 days a week, 15 hours a day.
translation.ja: 〈ここは週５日 15時間 営業してるので〉 ミシュラン３つ星シェフ アンドレの師匠

translation.en: Yes, of course.
translation.ja: ミシュラン３つ星シェフ アンドレの師匠 〈だよな〉

translation.en: I can't do anything else. Time is very limited.
translation.ja: 〈時間が限られていて 他に何もできないんです〉

translation.en: And you're going to do more in Taiwan?
People have been talking about Asian cuisines for a while,
translation.ja: 〈最近 アジア料理が 話題ですが〉 〈台湾は注目されてないので これから…〉

translation.en: but they never mentioned Taiwan, so in the future, I think it will…
translation.ja: 〈台湾は注目されてないので これから…〉

translation.en: -Be more popular. -Yes, it will.
RAW has been open for three and a half years.
translation.ja: 〈RAWはオープンして ３年半になります〉

translation.en: Yes, it can really become a culinary destination.
translation.ja: 〈料理を目的に 台湾に行く人が増えるよ〉

translation.en: Next month, Michelin is coming to Taipei.
translation.ja: 〈来月 ミシュランが 台北に来るんです〉

translation.en: Oh, right.
Yes, next month.
You won't participate in Michelin anymore, right?
Yes, I won't join anymore.
It doesn't matter to you now.
Well, in the future… You know how it is.
Yes.
Does your team rarely change?
Yes, our turnover rate is very low.
But that's good, I like this kind of kitchen.
It's like…
It's very straight forward. Yes, and that way, I am involved in everything.
translation.ja: 〈僕が全てに 関われるようになってます〉

translation.en: Then it won't…
You can see it all.
Yes.
The sous-chef has been here for ten years.
Yes.
-And you're close when you're not working? -Yes.
But they all work very hard.
translation.ja: 〈みんな本当に よく働いたので〉

translation.en: That's why sometimes, it's good to take a rest.
translation.ja: 〈みんな本当に よく働いたので〉 〈休むにはいい時期かと 思いました〉

translation.en: But after working at Restaurant André,
translation.ja: 〈スタッフはアンドレで 働いた経歴があるので―〉

translation.en: their path would be a little smoother in the future.
translation.ja: 〈転職は しやすいと思います〉

translation.en: The most important thing is to make sure that they have opportunities.
translation.ja: 〈この先も料理を 続けたい人のためにも〉

translation.en: Then the ones who want to continue on this path can do it.
translation.ja: 〈可能性を 広げてあげることが大事だ〉

translation.en: It's becoming harder to work with the new generation.
translation.ja: 〈新しい世代と働くと 考え方のズレを感じます〉

translation.en: They want to be the boss.
translation.ja: 〈みんなすぐに ボスになりたがるんです〉

translation.en: -Right away. -Yes.
They work here for a year and they want to be the boss.
translation.ja: 〈ここで１年働いて 独立とか〉

translation.en: They don't want to work at a top restaurant.
translation.ja: 〈一流店で 働きたくないんです〉

translation.en: And it's the same everywhere now.
Yes.
They'd rather make stupid muffins
with marmalade and bagels.
translation.ja: 〈マーマレードの ベーグルを出すだけで〉

translation.en: Then they're happy.
Young people these days
are the Internet generation where everything moves so fast.
translation.ja: 〈最近の若者は〉 〈ネット世代だから スピード感覚が速い〉

translation.en: -Yes, really fast. -Like this.
It's the same in Europe.
It's hard to find good staff in France now.
translation.ja: 〈フランスでもスタッフを 探すのに苦労してる〉

translation.en: They come and work for a week or maybe 15 days.
translation.ja: 〈１週間から15日間くらい 働いて―〉

translation.en: And when they don't like it, they leave without even taking their salary at times.
translation.ja: 〈気に入らなかったら 給料も受け取らずに去る〉

translation.en: One morning, they're just gone.
Yes.
-How is Chef Laurent doing? -Chef Laurent? He's good.
translation.ja: 〈ローラン･シェフは？〉 〈ローランか？ 元気だけど…〉

translation.en: Chef Laurent…
translation.ja: 〈ローランか？ 元気だけど…〉

translation.en: I always tell him that he's working too much. He's under too much pressure.
translation.ja: 〈本人にも言ってるが 働き過ぎだ〉

translation.en: It's not good for his health.
I think so too.
Even I can feel it working here for 15 hours a day.
translation.ja: 〈ここで１日15時間 働くだけでも感じます〉

translation.en: You need to listen to your body.
Your body will tell you when to slow down.
translation.ja: 〈ゆっくりしろと 体が言うタイミングがある〉

translation.en: -We never have the opportunity -No.
translation.ja: 〈こういう話をする機会が〉 〈今まで ありませんでしたね〉

translation.en: to talk about this.

translation.en: That's true.
But we never lost touch
translation.ja: 〈でも君とは この20年以上の間〉

translation.en: over the past 20 years.
translation.ja: 〈ずっと欠かさず 連絡を取り合ってた〉

translation.en: Even if sometimes we don't see each other

translation.en: or don't even talk for several months, the friendship is still strong.

translation.en: The food was amazing, but that was no surprise of course.

translation.en: That was no surprise.
Yes.
When I have more time,
I really want to go back

All right.

Let's see about Saigon or somewhere else.

This is unacceptable.
-Tony… -We'll change that.
-Control the fire. -Yes.
Turn it once in a while, if you…
The dishes here have just been served.
Why do these things keep getting smaller?
-This fish is small. -Yes.
They're becoming smaller. There are only five pieces here.
This has only four… five pieces.
Five pieces in total.
Should we spread them apart?
Because if they're too big, they'd stick together. Some pieces of fish are…

translation.en: -Don't arrange them too closely. -We must…
Spread them wider to make them look nicer.
translation.ja: 〈大きく見せるように 盛ったほうがキレイだ〉

translation.en: -Oui. -Oui.
Isn't it?
Yes, of course. You can't succeed if you're not tough.
translation.ja: はい でも厳しくないと 成長できません でも厳しくないと 成長できません ユン･ソヒョン 見習い

translation.en: It must be hard.
We cannot relax, we cannot sit down, we cannot take it lightly.

translation.en: It's good for us, I believe.
translation.ja: でもそれが 力になってると信じてます

translation.en: Yes. Actually, that was my plan.
translation.ja: そういう計画だったんです

translation.ja: おめかしして店に行って シェフに直談判しました

translation.en: "Chef, I want to work here." He said that there weren't any vacancies.
translation.ja: 空きがないと言われたので

translation.en: Okay, I will start by cleaning the toilet first. I'll start with that.

translation.en: -Oh my God. -Where's the…

translation.en: Can you hear me?
There are changes to the seating arrangements tomorrow.
Can my friends and I join tables with Grace?
translation.ja: 〈私と友達なんだけど グレースと相席でもいい？〉

translation.en: -We can? Okay, bye. -Yes? Okay, cool.
Seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen.
Go this way.
-I'm so happy. Yes. -Very happy to see you again.
"YOU'RE MY CHEF."
translation.ja: 〝あなたは私のシェフ 〞 〝あなたは私のシェフ 〞 私は元モデルです

translation.en: When I heard that the restaurant was closing,
translation.ja: 閉店の話を聞いた時は

translation.en: I felt very angry at first
translation.ja: まず怒りが こみ上げてきました

translation.en: because it was my dream to be here.
translation.ja: この店は私の夢でした この店は私の夢でした ユン･ソヒョン

translation.en: I want to commit my life here,
translation.ja: ユン･ソヒョン 人生を捧げたかった

translation.en: every off-day, every moment we're working together like a family.
translation.ja: 一緒に働いてる仲間は 家族同然でした

translation.en: So at first, I was very angry with him.
translation.ja: だから初めは腹が立って

translation.en: Why did you give up? Why do you want to close?
translation.ja: “なぜ諦めるの？”と 思いました

translation.en: We still haven't gotten three Michelin stars yet. We're not number one yet.
translation.ja: ベストレストラン１位も ３つ星もとれてないのに

translation.en: I will translate it into Mandarin for you tomorrow.
translation.ja: 〈明日 標準語に 訳してあげるよ〉

translation.en: Okay, thank you.
All the best.
Why did you give up, Chef?
Thank you, Chef.
Did you know that I would be a chef when I was a kid?
translation.ja: 〈僕が大人になったら シェフになると思った？〉

translation.en: No, not at all.
-Not 1.5kg? -Almost 3kg.
Seeing all this seafood makes you want to cook, right?
translation.ja: 〈見てると 料理したくなる？〉

translation.en: They're all so fresh.
The prawns look good too.
That one.
-Mother's Day Sale! -Yes.
Mother's Day Mega Sale!
Can I have an autograph?
-A discount for the whitebait in exchange? -Two fish for an autograph!
translation.ja: 〈シラスを〉 〈サインくれたら 魚２匹あげる〉

translation.en: -How many do you want? I'll give you two. -Two fish? I can't take them.
translation.ja: 〈サインくれたら 魚２匹あげる〉 〈そんな　悪いよ〉

translation.en: One bag for you.
I'm sorry, I didn't recognize you earlier.
You were standing in front of me for so long.
-Thank you. -Thank you. How much for the fish?
-No charge, it's fine. -Really?
You're too generous.
You're so tall. I haven't seen you in real life, you're so tall.
translation.ja: 〈実際に会うと すごく背が高いんですね〉

translation.en: Seeing that so many people like your son, how do you feel?
translation.ja: 息子さんの人気ぶりを見て どうです？

translation.en: I share his honor.
How do you say that in English?
Even though he's very popular,
all I wish for him is peace and health.
translation.ja: 〈心の平穏と健康だけが 私の願いです〉

translation.en: I hope he won't experience hardships.
Don't all mothers wish that for their children? Am I right?
translation.ja: 〈母親なら みんなそう願うと思うわ〉

translation.en: -Thank you. Happy Mother's Day! -Thank you.
translation.ja: 〈ありがとう 母の日おめでとう〉

translation.en: He was in such a faraway place.
As a mother, I didn't know
that being a chef would be so hard.
translation.ja: 〈こんなに大変とは 思わなかった〉

translation.en: He went over there
and lost a lot of weight.
He never tells me about the hardships that he had experienced.
translation.ja: 〈でも大変とは 絶対に言わないんです〉

translation.en: While he's at work, I would think about
what I should buy and which Taiwanese dishes I should cook for him.
translation.ja: 〈台湾料理を 作っておこうと思いました〉

translation.en: I don't know how to speak French, so when I went to the supermarket,
translation.ja: 〈私はフランス語を 話せませんが〉

translation.en: I simply thought that bacon would go well with anything.
translation.ja: 〈ベーコンを買っておけば 何とかなると思いました〉

translation.en: I bought tomatoes to make his favorite, fried eggs with tomatoes.
translation.ja: 〈そしてトマトを買って〉 〈卵とトマトの炒め物を 作ったんです〉

translation.en: Since he was a young boy, I never had to worry about him.
translation.ja: 〈子供の頃から 心配したことはありません〉

translation.en: I know that he has his own thoughts about what he wants to do every step of his way
translation.ja: 〈自分の考えを持って 目的のために行動する〉

translation.en: because I know him very well.
SAUSAGE WITH STICKY RICE
SMOKED BONELESS CHICKEN FEET
translation.ja: 台湾に帰った時の楽しみは… 〝鶏のくん製 〞 〝鶏のくん製 〞 〝鶏のくん製 〞 懐かしの味を食べることです

translation.en: I want an assorted one.
-Okay, do you want it spicy? -Yes.
-Okay. -I want it more burnt.
-No problem. -Thank you.
Can I have a photo with you?
Yes, of course!
Seeing you in person for the first time
makes me so happy!
-One, two, three. One more. Okay. -Thank you.
translation.ja: 〈はい チーズ〉 〈もう１枚　オッケー〉

translation.en: RAW is so hard to book. We couldn't get a reservation.
translation.ja: 〈RAWの予約が 取れませんでした〉

translation.en: Yes, RAW is quite popular,
translation.ja: 〈なかなか 空かないんですよね〉

translation.en: so you have to book it earlier, around two months in advance.
translation.ja: 〈２ヵ月前くらいだと 予約できるかも〉

translation.en: -Two months earlier would be best? -Yes.
translation.ja: 〈２ヵ月前に 挑戦してみます〉

translation.en: -I see, thank you! -Thank you, bye!
translation.ja: 〈２ヵ月前に 挑戦してみます〉 〈ありがとう〉

translation.en: -Chef, are you doing well these days? -Very well.
You're back in Taiwan now. What a waste!
No, it's not a waste.
I hope to spend more time in Taiwan.
translation.ja: 〈台湾で過ごしたいと 思ったんだ〉

translation.en: I never had the luxury of time to do so, but now I do.
translation.ja: 〈今までこんなに ゆっくりできなかったから〉

translation.en: But why do you want to come back to Taiwan?
The market for fine dining in Taiwan is not very good.
translation.ja: 〈台湾では高級レストランの 需要が少ない〉

translation.en: I think it's a mission for me.
If everyone believes that the environment won't improve,
translation.ja: 〈ずっと変わらないと みんなが思いこんだら〉

translation.en: then it will never improve.
Yes, now there's Danny's Steakhouse and other restaurants that are a bit…
translation.ja: 〈少しずつ 増えてはいますよね〉

translation.en: Just like how ten years ago, when I went to Singapore,
translation.ja: 〈10年前の シンガポールに行った時は〉

translation.en: they didn't have anything
-like Restaurant André. -Yes. So…
translation.ja: 〈アンドレのような店は まったくなかった〉

translation.en: I think…
it's up to us to create that environment
translation.ja: 〈自分たちに高級店は 不相応だと思うのではなく〉

translation.en: and not expect that the environment would be right for us.
-Is that so? -Yes.
-Okay, it's been a pleasure meeting you. -All the best.
We'll let you handle Taiwan's Michelin stars.
-Thank you! -Bye, Chef.
Bye.
Why is that lamp so slanted?
The one at the bottom.
You have to tighten the screw.
Is that okay? It's still slanted.
Okay, stabilize it.
And why is the ceiling making a weird noise?
It's the air conditioner.
Perhaps up there…
Chef said the air conditioner is too noisy.
It wasn't like that before.
It is, but it's quieter in the restaurant now, so you can hear it clearly.
translation.ja: 〈今は店内が静かなので 目立つのかと〉

translation.en: No.
It didn't.
We'll get someone to check on it.
That morning,
translation.ja: 〈朝 タクシーに乗って 出勤してる時に〉

translation.en: I was in a cab on the way to work
translation.ja: 〈朝 タクシーに乗って 出勤してる時に〉 エリーゼ･チェン 〈朝 タクシーに乗って 出勤してる時に〉 〈朝 タクシーに乗って 出勤してる時に〉 ＲＡＷ アシスタント マネージャー

translation.en: and I received a very surprising text that Chef was coming back to Taiwan.
translation.ja: ＲＡＷ アシスタント マネージャー 〈シェフが台湾に戻るという 知らせを受けたのです〉 〈シェフが台湾に戻るという 知らせを受けたのです〉

translation.en: My mind was blank.
When I entered the kitchen,
I saw that everyone was already discussing Chef's reason for coming back.
translation.ja: 〈シェフが戻る理由について みんなで話してました〉

translation.en: And the next reaction I had was, "Oh no, I'll be under a lot of stress because he's coming back."
translation.ja: 〈私はシェフが戻ることが プレッシャーでした〉

translation.en: So while everyone is happy that Chef is returning,
there's a part of us that is very worried about the stress.
translation.ja: 〈ストレスを 心配してる人もいました〉

translation.en: I don't want anyone to be lazy
translation.ja: 〈みんなには 怠けてほしくない〉

translation.en: and stop improving.
Talk about the wine we have today.
translation.ja: 〈今日のワインについて 話してもらおう〉

translation.en: This serves as a review for yourself and as a form of practice for your other colleagues.
translation.ja: 〈同僚に説明することで 自分の課題も見えてくる〉

translation.en: Then it becomes something that you've acquired. It's not only his and also not only hers.
translation.ja: 〈ワインはソムリエだけの ものじゃない〉

translation.en: You can ask Antoine or Sherry.
translation.ja: 〈アントニーや シェリーに聞くんだ〉

translation.en: When we were at Restaurant André, would we do that? We wouldn't.
translation.ja: 〈レストラン･アンドレでは みんな把握してた〉

translation.en: If the wine we're serving today is the same as yesterday,
we'd still include it in the briefing, right?
From the first bottle to the last, we'd go through them.
translation.ja: 〈最初から最後まで 通すんだ〉

translation.en: During our briefing, I don't wish for us to only talk about the good things.
translation.ja: 〈定例会では 悪いこともきちんと話す〉

translation.en: Every detail has to be covered.
So I want Antoine and Sherry…
After going through the usual items,
translation.ja: 〈まずは通常のボトルを 説明して〉

translation.en: let's talk about what we could have learned from yesterday
translation.ja: 〈昨日 学んだことの フィードバックと〉

translation.en: and what we should focus on today.
-Okay. -Okay.
-Bon service. -Bon service!
All ready?
Are you prepared?
-Yes. -Okay, let's open the doors.
Okay.
-Hello, how are you? -How are you?
Hi.
-Yes. -Yes.
-Yes. -Yes.
This one is not dusted?
-Which one? -This one.
It is.
Why can't I see any difference?
Can you see the difference?
It's all here.
-The dusting has to be enough. -Okay.
translation.ja: 〈もっと 分かるようにしないと〉

translation.en: Remember, the food has to match.
If you have three things,
one is hot, one is cold,
translation.ja: 〈温かいものと 冷たいものの場合〉

translation.en: -both must be served at the same time. -Yes, got it.
Or serve the salamander first before you serve the foie gras.
translation.ja: 〈それかフォアグラの前に サラマンダーを〉

translation.en: Okay.
-It's all dried up. Hey. -Yes.
-See you next time, bye. -Bye.
Thank you.
Chef, you're so cruel by cooking that at this time.
translation.ja: 〈この時間に作るのは 拷問です〉

translation.en: You're starving, aren't you?
It smells really good.
It's the flavor of Taiwan.
You think so?
I feel the same way too.
-You're going to get some… -Yes.
Do you want to go inside?
